Incredibly linear and uninspired. Overrated is the perfect word to describe this game. The vigors are so unimaginative it hurts; oh look you can shoot fire! The secondary ability? Fire trap. Oh wow, shoot crows, secondary ability? Crow trap... Oh look, you can shoot lightning, secondary ability? You guessed it, lightning trap. They get a bit more creative towards the end, but by then it was too late. The story is the only thing that carries the popularity of this game and even that is mediocre. 

I wanted to like Bioshock Infinite, I really did, I preordered it and played it on release. I thought the art style was gorgeous and Columbia was incredibly visually pleasing. Unfortunately the sense of discovery disappears quickly and you're left with shallow game mechanics and disappointment.

In the end playing through the game felt like a chore, buy this game if you enjoy tedious and repetitive gameplay with next to no innovation, drained of all potential to appeal to the lowest common denominator.

This game is incredible.

I played this on ultra graphics settings and the game looked beautiful. I have played the whole game right through till the end and I cannot recall a moment where I wasn't amazed by the visuals.

The storyline seems pretty basic till the end. Without revealin spoilers, the climax to this game really makes you think about tiny details you encountered at the start. The ending is so confusing though I feel they really should have included a more precise explaination of what happened to the characters and columbia.

The gameplay is really smooth and intricate, using vigours to overpower an enemy before dealing a final blow is incredibly fun. I love having Elizabeth run around finding ammo, salts and health for you in mid combat.

Overall I would say this game is a must buy. The only downside is the ending, it left me so baffled I had to look up an explaination for it. 9.5/10
I am not a man of many words but what i will say is this game is amazing,the best story and gameplay combination for a long time.

7.8 / 10
The presentation is gorgeous. Environs and details are spectacular in detail. Combat is rather mediocre as it uses the Bioshock 2  (two-armed) combat, but the vigors lack the variety and utility presented in previous Bioshocks. Player training is an issue in that once you find a new vigor, there is little incentive to explore its use and purpose. 
The narrative runs into many plot holes in that you are never given a genuine reason for the denizens of Colombia to come after you until Fink identifies you as the 'False Shepard'. This happens again later when the Vox are treating you like the second coming, then Fitroy disclaims you and then EVERYONE is after you. The ending is very memorable, on par with Portal's ending. 

In the end, the game is not as good as it's initial reviews, but doesn't quite deserve the backlash it seems to be getting in online forums. It's worth a few runs, but doesn't really call me back the other Bioshocks do.

I'm a big fan of story-driven games and Infinite is one of the best I've played. The combat is much smoother than the previous Bioshock games and the various Vigors are quite fun to use. Columbia looks beautiful, it's very colorful and vibrant. Excellent all around, one of the best games of the year by far.

(I'd recommend playing the first Bioshock, if you haven't already, before picking up this game. It helps you understand certain plot elements much better.)

This is a great game. The story really makes you think and the chracter design and environment building is really fantastic. Columbia feels like a real place to me. It is worth playing and is an unforgetable experience.

Bioshock Infinite's characters, setting, story, environments, and graphics are phenominal. But the combat is only okay. 

I'm the kind of person that will overlook a game's shortcomings if it can entertain me elsewhere, and I think everything in Bioshock Infinite more than makes up for this game's lackluster combat. Your companion Elizabeth is not a dumb AI to babysit; she will provide cover, ammo, escape routes, etc in combat and enemies don't seem to care about her existence. It's a bit weird, but the system is good in a way that you can only really screw yourself over with poor choices. And that'll happen often, due to being frail and combat being too hectic to have the time to make wise decisions.

But look at this game's screenshots. This is one of the best-looking games on PC right now. The game's setpieces are amazing, the world's history is fleshed out rather well, and Elizabeth's personality does a great job of making you care about your mission and the conflicts that arise as a result. 

Bioshock Infinite's story will blow your mind. I'd love to say why, but let's just keep it at that.

Great job Irrational Games. 
This is the kind of game I want. It's not perfect, the gameplay has some issues to fix, there are not reasons to use all the vigors for example (maybe they want you to choose what power you like), you can carry only two weapons at the same time or other little things like that (I think the gameplay works more than decently however), but all the other things are greatly done.
The setting is brilliant in every feature, I like the design, the idea of the city in the sky is awesome. The most important thing is: Columbia is alive. It's a "full" city, with its spirit, its believes and its problems. 
They've done an intersting work with Elizabeth, she interacts a lot with the environment and with the player. She is helpful in battle and soo human in all the scene where she is involved, expecially in the little scene where she is alone with Booker (essentially with you). You feel her feelings.
I don't wanna say anything about the story, I just say there are not many games with a plot and a narration of this level.

In conclusion I really enjoy the game and it could become one of my favs.
My final advice is: try it, love it.

Where to begin!? Exhilirating fights, breathtaking views, brilliant story that keeps you realing to the end! I must get for any lover of any videogames, not just Bioshock. Fantastic mechanics and brilliant design culminate into this masterpiece! I don't care who you are, get it!

I dont know if the story leaves as profound of an impact as bioshock 1, but it is leaps better than bioshock 2 and one of the more memorable/enjoyable fps I have played in recent memory. I was definitely look forward to getting home from work to continue this game, I cant say that for all FPS's.

Bioshock Infinite has the most intruiging storyline and the the most mind-bending ending of any game, movie, or book i have ever experienced. i'm still trying to wrap my head around it all.

the action is very good and the sky rail system is both innovative and interesting and adds a fun new twist; heck, even the NPC's like it.

i got Bioshock Infinite for $9.99 during the 2013 autumn sale and it was a steal.  you're cheating yourself out of a landmark gaming experience if you don't get this game - especially now during the 2013 holiday sale for the same price.

Just get it.

What is it?
BSI is a Steam Punk Americana FPS set in the fictional floating city of Columbia.

Pros:
- Great Story
- Original Characters that I cared about
- Breathtaking Locations
- Elizabeth was intuitive and useful

Cons:
- Gameplay tended to repeat alot (I found myself grinding through so I could get to the next tidbit of story)
- Last battle felt as if it was rushed by the design team

Conclusion:
8/10

10/10 would play again.

Game of year (for me).

BioShock Infinite.
Честно говоря, с момента анонса я относился весьма скептично к проекту, да и первые скриншоты в своё время откровенно смутили. Запустив игру и погуляв по миру первые часа полтора я направился на просторы интернетов, где решил поставить мозги на место, прочитав "сюжетку", чтобы "въехать" в суть происходящего, ибо та игра контрастов и красок, что царила на экране, не находила объяснения и породила массу вопросов, ответы на которые найти удалось лишь много позже. Пожалуй, больше всего расстроили дневники (аудио), оставшиеся даже без субтитров. Я знаю английский достаточно, чтобы понять большинство реплик. Но вот незадача, в это время может прилететь не один посторонний звук, может идти перестрелка.. Очень много проходит мимо.. Так же я не оценил подход разработчиков, когда чтобы узнать и понять мир в достаточной степени тебе нужно осмотреть каждый уголок.. Есть игры, где это интересно, где это подано как-то.. Иначе.. Но Infinite - явно не тот случай. 
Однако, информация - это самое ценное, что есть в этой игре. Только узнавая новые сведения о ключевых персонажах и событиях вы сможете оценить всю глубину игры. 
Сюжет - основная, если не единственная причина потратить на прохождение не 10-12 часов, а намного больше. BioShock Infinite преподносит нам историю на столько красивую, увлекательную и оригинальную, что по прохождению игры остается ощущение.. шока... Ничего столь восхитительного нам, игрокам, не представляли уже черт-его-знает сколько лет... Он (сюжет), подается очень дозированно, его порой не просто отследить и без сторонних данных (дневники, записки и пр.) собрать паззл порой просто невозможно, но когда ты начинаешь понимать, куда ты попал, зачем и какую роль тебе предначертано сыграть - игра цепляет намертво, на осталяя шанса оторваться от монитора. BioShock - бесконечно глубокая игра, которая раскрывает целый ворох фундаметальных вопросов, позволяя взглянуть на многие события с разных перспектив. 
Что касается механики - тут всё довольно неплохо. В BioShock 2 я, честно, не вытерпел даже часа игры. Однако могу сравнить Infinite с первой игрой и могу констатировать - механика боя стала несколько живее, при этом оставляя чёткое ощущение приемственности, она узнаваема с первого взгляда. геймплей разнообразили, имеет место "вертикальный геймплей", если выражаться терминами Crytek'а. Аэротрассы - фан на любителя. Впрочем, я не фанат серии, потому ругать сильно и хвалить геймплей не буду, откровенных изъянов в нем нет, но лично мне он попросту не по душе. Есть места с пострелушками, были места, где можно поиграть в "стелс", есть моменты с исследованием мира. Есть скрытые доп. миссии, для любителей исследовать всё и вся.
В целом, я бы поставил игре твердую 8, но сюжет.. это шедевр.. он вытягивает весь проект на 9/10, жаль только, что больше BioShock'ов мы, скорее всего, не увидим. Последняя часть вышла триумфальной, восхитительной, примером для всех шутеров, где есть место настолько восхитительному сюжету, что я удивлюсь, если к 2015му году не выйдет какой-нибудь фильм по мотиву... 
Рекомендую всем фанатам вселенной а так же всем любителям прекрасного. Эта игра создана с душой, она живая, яркая и способная покорить самое ледяное сердце...

Bioshock has proven itself in the past before, but this is something new to the table. With wonderful graphics, simple yet deep combat system, amazing story, and with unforgettable characters to top it off. It's nothing short of amazing. From the amazing scenery of the town, to the satire and imagery in the story line, the game will make sure you follow every step in the game. As it immerses you into the relationship between Booker and Elizabeth, you will feel LIKE the characters. I know many reviewers said it before, but I'll say it now. It's like a Disney story well written. I highly reccommend this title if you're looking for nostalgia, great, shooter, or a great story. Worth every penny.
